channel.title: How do I add an object?
channel.description: If I had the coordinates and object and I wanted to add and object where would I do it? And how would I make it so I can click on it and make an action, Like for example, make it so you click on it that it'll give you strength xp, just like a training statue....

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

so this is what it’ll look like?

	}
}
public void addGlobalObject(int 3156, int 3663, int 3353, int -1, int 10) {
	for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
		if(p != null) {
			client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
				if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) {
					person.placeObject(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

item.source: How do I add an object?

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[quote=“dragonchain, post:2, topic:153238”]Ok for example lets use my server for example… look at attached file for object ids and also go into your client.java and find:

addglobalobject

Ok once you found it, click find again then somthing will apear for example maybe like this:

AddGlobalObject(coord number (X), coord number(Y), object id, heigh, object kind);//object name

Well, if you wanted to add a dummie to train attack on you wud say

AddGlobalObject(coords, coords, ID, -2, 10);//dummy

But you see the 10 and the -2 at the end?? heres to help you understand:

FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration

Ok so when you log on your account and you want to find coords to put ur object type ::mypos

Ok once you placed the code in your client.java save close compile and run and there should be your object!

Thanks,

~Armo :D[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

[b]public void placeGlobalObject[/b](int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
	for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
		if(p != null) {
			client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
				if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) {
					person.placeObject(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}

[size=10pt]Change the placeGlobalObject to addGlobalObject[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: How do I add an object?

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

no, my server its, placeglobalobject… so what would i do?[br][size=1]Posted on: October 20, 2007, 11:26:36 PM[/size][hr]Here’s the way my client.java is set up:

[code]public void SpawnWorldObjects() {
for (int i = 0; i < server.worldObject.WorldObjectCount; i++) {
if (heightLevel == server.worldObject.ObjectHeight[i]) {
placeGlobalObject(server.worldObject.ObjectX[i], server.worldObject.ObjectY[i], server.worldObject.ObjectID[i], server.worldObject.Orientation[i], server.worldObject.TileObjectType[i]);
} else {
}
}
}
/* 0 = West || -1 = North || -2 = East || -3 = South /
/ tileObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration */
public void placeObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC(objectY - (mapRegionY * 8));
outStream.writeByteC(objectX - (mapRegionX * 8));

	outStream.createFrame(101);
	outStream.writeByteC((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	outStream.writeByte(0);

	if (NewObjectID != -1) {
		outStream.createFrame(151);
		outStream.writeByteS(0);
		outStream.writeWordBigEndian(NewObjectID);
		outStream.writeByteS((ObjectType<<2) + (Face&3));
	}
}
public void placeGlobalObject(int objectX, int objectY, int NewObjectID, int Face, int ObjectType) {
	for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players) {
		if(p != null) {
			client person = (client)p;
			if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")) {
				if(person.distanceToPoint(objectX, objectY) <= 60) {
					person.placeObject(objectX, objectY, NewObjectID, Face, ObjectType);
				}
			}
		}
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @X_F_U_R_Y_X X F U R Y X
item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

[quote=“dragonchain, post:2, topic:153238”]Ok for example lets use my server for example… look at attached file for object ids and also go into your client.java and find:

makeglobalobject

If you can’t find that then try to find:

addglobalobject

Ok once you found it, click find again then somthing will apear for example maybe like this:

AddGlobalObject(coord number (X), coord number(Y), object id, heigh, object kind);//object name

Well, if you wanted to add a dummie to train attack on you wud say

AddGlobalObject(coords, coords, ID, -2, 10);//dummy

But you see the 10 and the -2 at the end?? heres to help you understand:

FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration

Ok so when you log on your account and you want to find coords to put ur object type ::mypos

Ok once you placed the code in your client.java save close compile and run and there should be your object!

Thanks,

~Armo :D[/quote]

where would I add the globalobject thing:
AddGlobalObject(coords, coords, ID, -2, 10);//dummy, do I add it right under the AddGlobalObject(coord number (X), coord number(Y), object id, heigh, object kind);//object name?

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Oh forgot that here:

Uhh, so you know that the dummy object id is 823 right? Well find this:

[code]/OBJECT CLICK TWO/

public void objectClick2(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY) {

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(“admin”))
println_debug(“atObject2: “+objectX+”,”+objectY+" objectID: "+objectID);

switch(objectID) {

case 2213:
case 2214:
case 2566:
case 3045:
case 5276:
case 6084:
case 11758:
openUpBank();
break;[/code]

And under that put:

case 823: if (actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("WOW! Ur a DUMMY!"); setAnimation(1110); addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[18]), 18); actionTimer = 30; } break;

This one gaings 1500 exp to att hitpoints and slayer you can change the numbers with this list:

addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((1500*playerLevel[18]), 18);

List:

playerLevel[0] = Attack playerLevel[1] = Defence playerLevel[2] = Strength playerLevel[3] = Hitpoints playerLevel[4] = Range playerLevel[5] = Prayer playerLevel[6] = Magic playerLevel[7] = Cooking playerLevel[8] = WoodCutting playerLevel[9] = Fletching playerLevel[10] = Fishing playerLevel[11] = Firemaking playerLevel[12] = Crafting playerLevel[13] = Smithing playerLevel[14] = Mining playerLevel[15] = Herblore playerLevel[16] = Agility playerLevel[17] = Thieving playerLevel[18] = Slayer playerLevel[19] = Farming playerLevel[20] = Runecrafting

This is from my server so you can edit it if you want!

Thanks,

~Armo

Read full topic

item.title: How do I add an object?
item.dc:creator: @dragonchain dragonchain
item.description:
@dragonchain wrote:

Ok for example lets use my server for example… look at attached file for object ids and also go into your client.java and find:

makeglobalobject

If you can’t find that then try to find:

addglobalobject

Ok once you found it, click find again then somthing will apear for example maybe like this:

AddGlobalObject(coord number (X), coord number(Y), object id, heigh, object kind);//object name

Well, if you wanted to add a dummie to train attack on you wud say

AddGlobalObject(coords, coords, ID, -2, 10);//dummy

But you see the 10 and the -2 at the end?? heres to help you understand:

FACE: 0= WEST | -1 = NORTH | -2 = EAST | -3 = SOUTH ObjectType: 0-3 wall objects, 4-8 wall decoration, 9: diag. walls, 10-11 world objects, 12-21: roofs, 22: floor decoration

Ok so when you log on your account and you want to find coords to put ur object type ::mypos

Ok once you placed the code in your client.java save close compile and run and there should be your object!

Thanks,

~Armo

Read full topic
